intro: Scolymocephalus longiflorus, commonly known as the long-flowered scolymus, is a flowering plant characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, elongated flowers. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Scolymocephalus longiflorus is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
